Introduction
This topic includes policies and procedures for determining whether pain or another condition may be accepted as a disability diagnosis based on whether there is associated functional impairment of earning capacity, including
conditions resulting in functional impairment of earning capacity
evidentiary requirements to demonstrate functional impairment of earning capacity
impact of
Saunders v. Wilkie
on diagnoses of pain
, and
Martinez-Bodon v.Wilkie
on determinations regarding functional impairment of earning capacity
examples of diagnosis of pain
, and
example of functional impairment of earning capacity due to other condition
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section C - Reviewing Diagnoses
citation: Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section C
